comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Probably the wife of William Cox Redfield (1858-1932); Mr. Redfield was Secretary of Commerce from 1913 to 1919. Mrs. Redfield was a clubwoman based in Brooklyn NY. Here's the text of a letter Herbert Hoover wrote to Mrs. Redfield upon her widowhood: www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/index.php?pid=23127

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca:

It looks like this is probably the wife of William Cox Redfield, as you said.  Thanks!  We will update our source data and reload the description.
